physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Cyanosis, feeding difficulty, persistent jaundice, micropenis, poor weight gain; large anterior and posterior fontanelle, mild pulmonic stenosis, hyperteleorism.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The patient initially presented with feeding difficulties and growth issues. Over time, neck rigidity developed with an inability to turn the neck.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Neck rigidity and limited neck rotation (approximately 90Â°). Cervical spine x-rays and MRI showed normal alignment and configuration. Neurological exam revealed mild hypotonia, immature prehensile skills, possible bilateral deltoid weakness, and weakness in neck muscles.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Neck rigidity and limitation in neck rotation were not present at birth but developed over the patient's early years.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Repeat MRI confirmed a post-contrast hypointense lesion in the anterior pituitary consistent with a microadenoma.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: MRI performed shortly after birth showed a similar hypointensity, indicating the presence of a microadenoma.
